abstract: Nomura Holdings, Japan’s largest brokerage, said it agreed to acquire Citigroup’s Japanese trust banking unit for $196 million to bolster its asset administration business.
snippet: Nomura Holdings, Japan’s largest brokerage, said it agreed to acquire Citigroup’s Japanese trust banking unit for $196 million to bolster its asset administration business.
lead_paragraph: Nomura Holdings, Japan’s largest brokerage, said it agreed to acquire Citigroup’s Japanese trust banking unit for 19 billion yen ($196 million) to bolster its asset administration business.

headline.main: Nomura Says It Will Buy Citi Unit in Japan
